sentences.en: Behavior that causes discomfiture or annoyance in another.
sentences.cn: 他的愚蠢行为使他丢失了工作.

sentences.en: He may laugh at our discomfiture now, but before long he'll be laughing on the other side of his face.
sentences.cn: 他现在可以对我们幸灾乐祸, 但是要不了多久他就会转喜为忧.

sentences.en: He was really not masterful enough mentally, and he had witnessed her discomfiture.
sentences.cn: 他的确在精神上不够老练, 况且他亲眼见到了她的狼狈情况.

sentences.en: I laughed my head off when I heard of his discomfiture.
sentences.cn: 听到别人说起他的狼狈相,我放声大笑.

sentences.en: People laugh not only from pleasure or affection, but also at the discomfiture of someone else.
sentences.cn: 人们不仅因为愉悦和喜爱而笑，也会在他人造成挫折或尴尬的局面时而笑。

sentences.en: Scarlett wanted to giggle at her discomfiture, for Rhett had caught her fairly.
sentences.cn: 思嘉看见她这副狼狈相忍不住要笑出声来, 因为瑞德抓住她的要害了.

sentences.en: She couldn't disguise her glee at their discomfiture.
sentences.cn: 他们受挫,她不禁喜形于色.

sentences.en: She was easily frightened, and she always carried off her discomfiture by a concession.
sentences.cn: 她是很容易受惊害怕的, 她常常以让步来打发她的窘困.

sentences.en: Why did he always think of HIM when he was in discomfiture?
sentences.cn: 何以他总是在狼狈不堪时想起那个人?

sentences.en: Without experiencing discomfiture and setbacks, one can never find truth.
sentences.cn: 不经过失败和挫折, 便找不到真理.

words.tran_cn: 挫败；扰乱，破坏；使…为难；使…破灭
